It had been developed using the best hydrological model available, and the plan had three parts.
First, temporarily stop building homes and businesses up on the ridges around Main Street to control runoff.
Second, build new retention ponds and bigger culverts so the water that did come down wouldn't flood the road as much.

The third part of the plan was to tear down 10 buildings on Main Street to make room for the river.
And this is where the story of the people of Ellicott City becomes the story of climate change in America.
